website_summaries.verdict: Sturdy, retractable ratchet straps that will keep your cargo secure and the straps from blowing in the wind.
pros: Retractable design, so unused length is stored around a center spool where it won't get damaged
Made of durable fabric that won't stretch or fray over time

customer_reviews.title: Boom schnickety straps yo!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I was tired of figuring out what to do with all the excess strap. Had a 1200 mile journey with the kayak on the roof of my SUV. Just awesome! Straps cinch tight and no strap flapping in the wind! Some reviews say they come loose or don't tighten properly but I think that is operator error. You don't depress the rachet when done and tight like you would with other straps. These you tighten up and leave wherever the last rachet click is. If you bring the rachet all the way down, the strap loosens. Boom schnickety straps yo!
customer_reviews.author: rossi

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 22 year old girl and for the life of me I could not figure out how to get my dirt bike strapped in by myself. These straps worked wonderfully! It only took me five minutes to get my bike strapped in safely to my bike carrier with these straps! They retract well and without tangles if you go slow and work much better than regular ratchet straps! I would highly recommend these to anyone that has troubles using ratchet straps
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Best Tie-Down Straps
customer_reviews.text: I have used many tie-down straps over the years and these are the best ones I have used. I love the retractable feature. I have use other brands of retractable straps and the Erickson Pro Series Retractable Ratcheting Tie-Down Straps are far superior. The ratchet levers work smoothly and they release easily and do not bind up. I now have three sets of these straps and have not had any problems with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk! Bon't buy
customer_reviews.text: You would think that if there was a defect it would only be in one of the straps. WRONG! BOTH straps are nothing but junk, cheaply made. Both of the ratchet mechs are stripped, meaning you can't torque them down at all. Might as well use shoe string! Now this is what gets me: Same company makes an outstanding ratcheting strap in red in a 4 pack. I bought it and all 4 are perfect. These you WILL like: Erickson 04418 Pro Series Red 1" x 10' Cost a little bit more, but they DO work!
customer_reviews.author: Willee

customer_reviews.title: Best ratcheting straps ever (! EVER !)
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was a little skeptical when I saw these. Worried about the quality and if they would extend far enough. These straps get used daily by me in my trade as an electrician and they are holding up well over a year later! I recommend these to anyone who I see trying to use straps you have to feed the strap through an eye pull right then ratchet. Those are so time consuming and leave extra strap hanging down that needs to be dealt with. These don’t, and so they have my vote! I’ve bought about 6 pairs of them now, and will likely buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought these at Cabela’s 3+ years ago. I use them often to tie down my ATVs. Out of the 4 originals, only one started to jam after about 2 years. I bought a new pack on Amazon 10 months ago and none of them have had any issues, including the other 3 that I have had for years. Very easy to use, durable, and definitely not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to strap down mowers on my trailer for my lawn business. They work great especially since you click the button and they wind themselves up tight. I even had the ratchet part drag behind my trailer due to not using a good secure point, i got stopped and sure enough, IT STILL WORKED! Excellent buy! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: ATLReviewer

customer_reviews.title: great idea, but have had a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, I mean the best idea ever for straps, but I have had a defective one that won't seem to ratchet(out of the package) and have had a couple break over time. The ones that still work make them all worth it, wish they had a little bigger and longer though. it would be 5 stars if I didn't have the defective one out the package and the other 2 broken ones....For the record, I have not actually broke the strap, but the ratcheting mechanism quit ratcheting.
customer_reviews.author: A. King

customer_reviews.title: Rusty useless recoil springs.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. They self retract to the length that you need and just ratchet to snug up. The problem comes in a few months down the road after using them in wet and slightly muddy driving. They start to not retract all the way, then not at all. Turns out that the spring is covered with plastic riveted to the body. The sprig as I can see through an opening in the plastic shield has become extremely rusty rendering the recoil useless. Consider conditions these will be used in before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: southernpendesigns

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.text: I'm tellin' ya. You'll never go back to the old kind again. Nothing could be easier to use! I strapped up and un-strapped my 4-wheeler in half the time with no flapping strap flopping in the wind!
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought different ratchets to tie down my paddle boards to my roof and it would take 30 mins to thread and use and then retread because the strap was too long. I decided to buy these and in 5 mins we are off to the lake. So easy to use and store. I enjoy not having extra straps flapping in the wind. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn M

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these straps to make "quick work" on my UTV trailer despite the bad reviews. And just like others have mentioned, they really are a great concept. I have only used them 5 times, I haven't gotten them wet, and I stored them in the truck. One doesn't retract all the way and the other stopped retracting completely.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Conklin

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a bucket of tangled straps
customer_reviews.text: I keep 6-8 straps in my truck and I'm so tired of trying to keep them from tangling. This is a perfect solution for me. Easy to use, ratchets nicely, and coils right back up with no more mess. The only downside would be the bulk of the retraction mechanism. But, worth it, in my opinion. I'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Dracx

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up at all, both straps broken within 200 miles of the first trip they were used for.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend these straps. Even though they are easy to use, both straps were broken by the time we stopped on the first trip out. We tied them in a knot to continue the trip and they they must have stretched because at the next stop about another 50 miles both had loosened up and were letting the cargo move around.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hance

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: I loved the difference these made in securing my kayak to my trailer. They are super easy to install and they store very compact. No more tangled mess. The problem is that one of the ratcheting mechanisms stopped working two weeks shy of a year after purchase. The straps were never stored outdoors and always sprayed/lubricated after each use. No corrosion is visible. Was a good year of ratcheting worth it? I don't think so. I'll search for a different brand next time. Was great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Magana

customer_reviews.title: do not fear the strength of the ratchet or the strap they are just as good if not better than any other brand
customer_reviews.text: Why retractable w ratchet straps are not the norm is beyond me. The convenience here is incredible and take the "Chore" out of securing things to your truck. I own 3 pairs of these and have used them fairly regularly for 6 months now, only one of the straps retractable feature has failed and its probably only due to being used in the pouring down rain. I would buy it again at this price even if it only lasted 3 months. No doubt the only weak point is the retractable feature, do not fear the strength of the ratchet or the strap they are just as good if not better than any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great straps for a year or two???
customer_reviews.text: I loved these straps and have purchased at least 12 of them. After a couple years of use the release mechanism has failed on all but 2. Have to release them with a screw driver every time. Finally got sick of it and replaced them all with the traditional straps, have tie the leftover strap, but better than jamming a screw driver in each one.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lovers

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome. I should have bought these years ago!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I love them. I bought the 2" set a while back thinking they are better for strapping down my motorcycles on my trailer while traveling but they are kind of too big and heavy, so I bought a set of these. They release easier, are easier to handle, and still are strong enough to hold down my bikes without worry. I will definitely use these more often than the 2" ones but will still use both depending on my needs. The 2" straps will work great for holding tarp, brush, and furniture down for sure.
customer_reviews.author: IAmTheJudgeOfNoOne

customer_reviews.title: Useless !!!!
customer_reviews.text: These looked just like the REESE Ratchets I purchased at Walmart so I bought six of these. Four for a subcontractor and two for myself. I put mine in the truck until I needed them. Just recently my subcontractor told me they didn't work stating that they "slipped." I did not believe him so I tried mine and found he was right. These are absolutely useless and I am totally pissed because now I cant get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Donald Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: After owning sports cars for the last 10 years, my husband and I recently bought a new Tacoma. It has been great for Costco trips and hauling stuff in the bed, but I recently bought a vintage desk and needed it to be transported securely. I researched and researched (admittedly more than I probably needed to for ratcheting tie-downs) and finally decided that these retracting tie-downs would be best for storing in the cab and not having the excess tie material getting tangled. These are easy to operate and my desk made it home safe and sound. We'll have to see how they stand up to use over time, but I'll update review if my rating changes from 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SRinSD

customer_reviews.title: Why would you not use these?! Saves so much time and anguish
customer_reviews.text: Hands down will only use a retractable tie down for the truck bed. After trying to untangle feet upon feet of numerous tie downs and straps the hubs decided this was a better solution and wow is it! This is so easy to use and tie stuff down with. We use it to take stuff to the dumps, tie down our camping gear and hold things from moving in the truck bed. If you have to use a ratchet strap get this one for use.
customer_reviews.author: girlypantsTop Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: These are GREAT!. No mystery on how to use
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT!. No mystery on how to use. Just keep a little tension on re wind and your good to go. Love this product. Very smart design and works well if you re wind with some tension, otherwise, it gets confused. Cannot testify to the total strength of the product but I never tried to use them to pull a heavy load. I use them to tie things down to the trailer and they do a great job of that.
customer_reviews.author: . Russell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: The spring mechanism is cheaply made and sometimes works, sometimes doesn't. Vendor does not support the product. Ask yourself- do you want a ratchet strap that doesn't ratchet properly and may come loose during your trip. Returned the item and this vendor claims there was nothing wrong and didn't refund the return shipping. Do yourself a favor and buy the Lift All brand retractable ratchet straps, much better constructed and only slightly more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Surfabond

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, need thicker and stronger straps
customer_reviews.text: The concept of the idea is great, absolutely loved it however the durability of the straps was not good. To thin and easy to tear vs having a thicker strap. I tried them to hold my riding mower and they held and did great but they did not seem to do as well as my thicker strap that can handle or better.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Edenburn

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had discovered these a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: In the past couple years I have gone through a ton of ratcheting tie down straps. None until now have been worth a darn and I end up throwing them out and buying some other brand within a month. Not any more. These Erickson 34415 Pro Series straps are great. They are easy as can be to tighten down and release and no more loose ends flapping around. I couldn't be happier. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: steveschulzTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: These Erickson 33415 work great and are easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great when we packed two moving pods for our interstate move. They are made from a strong material, they are easy to use, lock nicely in place and are relatively low in cost compared to other comparable products.
customer_reviews.author: Lori J from Estero

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use / secure your loads
customer_reviews.text: I find these to be a very good set of straps for my needs. I have secured antiques, toys, tarps, mattresses with these and they have worked as expected. They are easy to reel out and in and secure well.I keep these in the house when not in use, so I cannot speak to how they will hold up in the weather . I am pleased and have purchased as gifts for family members.
customer_reviews.author: w8n4simplertimes

customer_reviews.title: They dont last
customer_reviews.text: Over the years iv bought 3 sets of 2. of the 1" x 10' The reason I keep getting more is they ALWAYS break. (The retract fails )Ill try the other brand that cost more
customer_reviews.author: planb

customer_reviews.title: Best ratcheting clamp I've had so far.
customer_reviews.text: Best ratcheting clamp I've had so far. The retractable feature makes one-handed use a breeze. They have a heavier grade of steel for the ratchet and so far, have worked flawlessly. I'm ordering two more pair to replace the old style ones for my trailer. I feel they are a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: hairyliver

customer_reviews.title: Throw away your old ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.text: These are a game changer. No more tangled mess whenever you need to tie anything down. No more charlottes web of excess strap you can’t seem to tie down. Perfect idea.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: when they work they work good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for over a yr.i had trouble with some not rewinding all the way.i love the feature of not having straps dangling when not in use.amazon is understanding when it comes to returning the bad ones.that is why I continue to buy them.when they do work I love them.i use 6 at a time on my truck and utility trailer
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Retractable straps
customer_reviews.text: I have a Toyota Tacoma and I have 4 of the retractable straps. I will never use another regular strap. These are easy to use and you never have a problem with them being all tangled up...simply Fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and good design.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great convenience. I've had six or so of similar design for many years. They're slow and the uptake now (kinda' like the owner) but still functioning. The web is beginning to fray on the old ones so I bought a set of these. The weak link in these is that red button. The older ones just had a spring and bracket to manipulate. The design on these is great. How long it'll last is another story. For now, they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Way easier than any other tie down I have tried!
customer_reviews.text: Where on Earth have these things been? Holy cow these make tying down loads so much easier than ever before! I use these on light to medium loads; I wouldn't use the for heavy duty applications (obviously) but for securing gear like rolling carts, speaker cabinets, bikes, and furniture inside my trailer, these things can't be beat. Now the trick is to be patient when using these. If you are one of those kinds of people that is always in hurry or just blasts through tasks, these can get a little bit twisted as they retract. My advice: take your time securing and releasing these straps. You'll be greatful you did.
customer_reviews.author: A. KING

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Love them. I have been using some 7ft retractable tie downs for years but they were often to short for a job. Finally I bit the bullet and got these. Plenty of length for occasional covered loads I make in my half ton truck.
customer_reviews.author: tsmdav

customer_reviews.title: Handy with no hassle from the straps
customer_reviews.text: I use these to cinch gas cans to my rear rack on the back of my FJ. They stay inside most of the time fastened across the vehicle from side to side. They seem solid so far in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Beevman

customer_reviews.title: Webbing is weak - the rest is great.
customer_reviews.text: Ratchet mechanism works great. Concept is great. Nylon webbing is really thin. This works great as long as the nylon is not rubbing on anything. The first time we used it to tie down a Ranger, the webbing almost frayed right through. It is half as thick as most other straps I have used. I still use the non-damaged one all the time - it is way more convenient than what I have used in the past. They have another one out there with a wider webbing - even though it has thin, I have not had an issue with it (but I am slightly more careful about where it rubs.)
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, but pretty large
customer_reviews.text: I really like these straps, makes the job easy and fast. But they are larger than regular straps, so you will need a bit more space to store them.
customer_reviews.author: duliskov

customer_reviews.title: Nice - for a year
customer_reviews.text: Awesome straps. Third set - I use frequently and they wear out after about a year or two. They don’t release / gets very difficult to release after use. So I replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kaupp

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and shoddy workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: The ratchet wheel on one side miss the tab on the crank lever. The stitching on the strap was done with a dull needle, setting up a weak point. The spool is a large enough diameter, and handle so short that it is difficult to apply much of a bind. I had to return.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Dailey

customer_reviews.title: No more for me thank you
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy mechanisms they would be great if they were bolted down but for normal tie downs they bounce around flopping even when tight which can make them loosed up
customer_reviews.author: bezerker

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: Only used once so far but the retractable feature is light years ahead of using the others that you have to untangle constantly. Set one hook, carry the end to the other hook, ratchet tight and done. When you unhook you just push the button and the strap winds up nice and neat. Of course, you have to keep the strap flat and straight when rewinding but that's not a problem. Can't tell yet how durable the mechanism is but if the retracting mechanism keeps working this well for a long time these will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used these once since purchasing. They were easy to use. They are solid. It’s really nice not having to deal with extra strap trailing behind.
customer_reviews.author: Parnone

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this product...I've tried others and they get all jammed up. So far these have worked perfectly and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sigler

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of these being easier to use and no worries about tangles. However, if you don't have at least foot of extension it doesn't want to tighten down very well. One of mine even stripped the gears, so it doesn't really get tight now. Purchased these over the boatbuckle, but maybe I'll try them now?
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Work perfectly.  Or do they?
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tied down straps I have used. I bought similar ones at a big box store and they pale in comparison. These have longer straps that release easier and retract much better. I will be buying more. Update 9/4/2016: I bought more. And the quality has dropped significantly since my first purchase. The 2 new tie downs slip repeatedly when I try to ratchet them down. I've used them once and they both disappointed me. I may not used them again.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: ATV worthy!! I love these things!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things....strong and durable. Never will 4 wheel without a couple of pairs of these. I use them on my wheeler truck boat you name it. there everywhere. the rollup process is so simple and fast I will never buy another set of regular ones again. I just went on an ATV hunt in AK and bought these to secure gas tanks with. something fast and strong. man did they do that! I bought more of them for the next trips! Take it from me ...Good price...great product...convinience....durable ....worth having!!! BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: lonnie feller

customer_reviews.title: Buy these instead of the 8’ ones
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought the 8’ ones before and sometimes wish they were just a couple of feet longer so since they have worked for a long time and haven’t broke like the cheap ones I decided to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Davids opinion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best straps I’ve found with retractable mechanisms. Super convenient and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: pitbullguy

customer_reviews.title: Check your strapping
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. These were bought by a friend that we Recommended to him. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sherry w.

customer_reviews.title: Started off great....
customer_reviews.text: As others have posted they were great at first buy now when I tighten the strap the mechanism skips teeth and won't get tighter.
customer_reviews.author: James L.

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My husband has been hunting for these a very long time. I found them online in less than a minute. He uses these for everything he loads onto his trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sabella

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These self retracting tie downs are legit. Work great. I purchased the 10’ - 2 ct. and I’m very happy. Great purchase. Great price. Don’t hesitate on buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Have used a few times now and they work great. Way easy to use than typical tie down. The retractable mechanism make this so easy to keep organized and strap down a load. A little expensive but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Handy but cheaper can be found
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these and they are handy. Two issues make it non-perfect: I found similar ones locally for much cheaper; and the actual ratcheting length is not very long (and I would never stress the spring to pull the full distance out either ... it appears to get quite taught when pulling it out). I used it once and it is a lot nicer than the many I have that I have to unfurl and then roll up each time >>> and I seem to be the guy everyone asks to help move things :-)
customer_reviews.author: dralexy

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: I love these straps . They are Quick and easy to use. I definatly would recomend .
customer_reviews.author: Nessa

customer_reviews.title: Bulky Mechanism, But Ease of Use Can't Be Beat
customer_reviews.text: These strapes are really nice but the ratcheting mechanism is bulky; however, this is to be expected as the whole strape is stored within it. I will gladly take the added bulk for the ease of use they offer. These ratcheting strapes are by far the best I have owned. One of the first ones I ordered did not retract fully on its own, so be sure to check that before using them. Amazon was quick to send a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: mookr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, these straps save me significant time and frustration ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these out of frustration dealing with regular ratchet straps (which I have been using often for many many years). So far so good, these straps save me significant time and frustration (especially frustration) from dealing with the tangled strap syndrome. Everyone that sees them wants to get a pair, and says they wonder why they never had them before.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer P.

customer_reviews.title: What a great product! Fast and easy to put on or ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the regular non-retracting straps to hold down my motorcycles for years and bought these because I was tired of having all the extra loose strap to deal with after I got the bike tied down. What a great product! Fast and easy to put on or off which is especially helpful when you are trying to strap down a bike by yourself. And no straps flapping in the breeze. I also tried another brand of less expensive retractable ratchet straps and one of them broke the first time I used it, so go with the Erickson's not the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Terry S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Way better than normal rachet straps. They dont get tangled and they dont have excess strap blowing around the truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really know what to expect when I got this but after one use it was clear that this strap was the way to go. If you're strapping down something and you have a lot of leftover strap you either have to tie it off or wrap it up with this ratchet strap no need for that I love it
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Solid build !! - just be careful when you hit the recoil button.
customer_reviews.text: Well made - only issue is to be careful when you hit that red button - if you're not careful that heavy solid S-hook will hit you! The spring roll mechanism is really strong !
customer_reviews.author: D. Lalla

customer_reviews.title: Too cool!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these but I will admit that they are pretty cool. After having far too many ratchet straps with ends that dangle and get chewed up by the road, having a self-contained unit was a dream come true. Just pull out what you need then ratchet them down. When you are done, a simple press and they retract completely - simple! My only complaint is the price. It could be lower, but you get what you pay for and these are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Boomtastic

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life. Really a nice retractable design. If you thinking about needed then, buy them they are awesome. I use them to hold down my Yamaha Generator in my truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent efficiency, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these twice and the ease of these versus the older style system of winding straps through the right way etc is incredible. They are quick. You can adjust easily. You can store and breakdown easily. Top notch product that works.
customer_reviews.author: itsbrick

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great ratchet strap. So easy to use and well worth it
customer_reviews.author: bren

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use one handed and durable
customer_reviews.text: these are the easiest of the 4 or 5 i have gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Dreric

customer_reviews.title: I am able to recoil the excess strap easily, great for one handed operation
customer_reviews.text: With 10 foot of strap I am able to tie down my mower with ease.I also use it for a tie down with the tarp in the back of the truck. The one handed operation makes for easy and quick work to get the load tied down. I love it. I am going to order 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with this tie down.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these to hold down a restored 112 John Deere I use as a show tractor and they work very well. The lock and release feature is really easy to use and it locks tight . The excess belt is wrapped in a nice case and stays clean. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: country boy

customer_reviews.title: good price.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest to use ratcheting straps I've ever used! I've always had problems loosening the straps when it's time to remove the item that is tied down, but these straps have a simple release system that is not based on how strong you are: just unlock the gears, push the button, and pull the strap to give wiggle room to unhook the S-hooks. Self-containing when you're finished using them. Used them to secure a washer, dryer, and dishwasher to a dolly for moving. Used them a few weeks later to secure lawn furniture in the back of a pick-up. Simple to use, won't tangle while not in use, good price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Emmele

customer_reviews.title: erickson ratcheting straps
customer_reviews.text: these are my favorite straps, i have them tie down my ladders on my van plus use them for transporting pipe on my roof racks. they lock items down . not like the bungee cords that break off and slam you in the face. their easy to retract and ratchet. if you carry items on a roof rack or on back of pickup, these straps will make your life a lot easier, with the peace of mind that they wont come undone when your on the highway.
customer_reviews.author: glenn mclellan

customer_reviews.title: But these they are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Best straps I have ever used this is my second pair so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: serenity

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so great! I love these and wish I found them earlier. It is great that there is no dealing with the extra strapping since it self stores. It not only keeps the unit clutter free for storage, it also helps when trying to secure items (it's easier to keep some tension on the line), and when traveling there is no tying up extra cord length to avoid flapping.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: They work and I always plan to have these with me on trips and in the cars/boat.
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well. I have several standard straps for heavier duty jobs but having these for the light weight and "quick" tie downs of things without having to manage a long strap yourself is great. I definitely plan to have this in my stash of random straps everywhere I go.
customer_reviews.author: Sip

customer_reviews.title: These work great. It's a touch tricky to get them to ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. It's a touch tricky to get them to release and retract but once you figure it out all is well. I use these to tie down a kayak so I can't attest to any real heavy loads but they've worked wonderfully so far. I don't think I'd ever go back to regular tie straps. Very convenient. I docked a star because they can be a touch finicky on release, don't let that keep you from buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Calestus

customer_reviews.title: An excellent improvement on a commonly used product ONLY LASTED A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: For those of us that have to use tie down straps on a regular basis, the difficulty of keeping the straps in order so that they can be easily use is well understood. By retracting the extra strap, these tie downs solve this problem. They appear well built and once you get the hang of it, they operate smoothly. Highly recommended. BACK ONE YEAR LATER, AFTER ONE YEAR OF USE THESE STRAPS LOCKED UP AND COULD NO LONGER BE USED.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great design and strong just doesn’t Reel back in all the wayall
customer_reviews.text: I love this table of ratcheting straps But this one doesn’t like to be real in all the way
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Get these.
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Worth the money. Hated the none retractable kind.
customer_reviews.author: carlo

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt buy them again
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of these and one failed to tighten almost like a gear is stripped. I just kept them in my truck so too much time has passed for a return
customer_reviews.author: Justin Justice

customer_reviews.title: At first it worked and then trouble set in
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of them and at first it was great. Worked as expected (a little bulky but accepted it due to the functionality). After about 4 months 3 of the 4 stop retracting at all. The last one will retract about half way. Sort of defeats the purpose of these. Save your money and invest in better mechanical item or resort to the old school way.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I like every thing about these easy to use tie straps Going to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Pio U.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust, use back up
customer_reviews.text: First time I used them, on broke within 5 miles, good thing I had it backed up with a cheaper strap, that didn’t break. I really thought these were going to be awesome. Sadly I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 chance!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two to strap down my boat and one of them locked up and was unable to release it! Had to cut the strap so I could get the boat off the trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Cuffem311

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Work fairly well. I wish the retract had a bit more tension. But it gets the job done holding my SxS to the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty slick concept. So far so good. Nice not having to deal with long loose straps blowing around.
customer_reviews.author: New Day Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Great - but ....
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE their function. I use them to secure my ATV to the trailer for transport and the first several months I was in heaven being able to press the button and zip the straps in for storage. When not in use they were in my ATV back storage box, or in the back of my car, never sitting out in the weather when not actively used. after a year they started acting up releasing and retracting, I found corrosion of the metal was a problem though they weren't stored outdoors. I now spray them with WD-40 periodically, but they don't work like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in NH

customer_reviews.title: Best tie down straps
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tie down straps made. No more fighting with tangled straps or extra strapping hanging around. Easy to store away because the strap winds into the tool. I did have one 2" strap mechanism fail out the 8 straps I bought.
customer_reviews.author: WHD6

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use but I need something I can trust
customer_reviews.text: Broke in the first 24 hours of use while hauling kayaks. I don't have any confidence in this product. It is easy to use but I need something I can trust.
customer_reviews.author: K. DEMO

customer_reviews.title: Will not retract after use.
customer_reviews.text: Used once each, for about 2 months of constant tension, and when I needed them to auto retract, they wouldn’t. Thought I must be doing something wrong, but other reviews show it’s common.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher W. Hagwood

customer_reviews.title: Retractable straps, very easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Great Straps for light tie-downs.... but one" x10' were not very sturdy for hauling heavy loads on our trailer. My husband really liked the design, so we ordered a heavier pair for strapping down heavy loads on our trailer and we used the Erickson 1"x10' for ratcheting down the bee hives to prevent bears from getting in! Easy to use and I love the retractable system, I just wish they were heavier duty for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: TJTomato

customer_reviews.title: Great for work trucks
customer_reviews.text: Open order needs for my trucks for work they are great.
customer_reviews.author: C-MAC

customer_reviews.title: Holds Great!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than traditional straps I have been using for years. I don't think I will be choosing any others from here on out. It Simply Works and holds! I would suggest to others, before use, to work the straps back and forth and repeatedly pressing the locking button. It wouldn't hurt to lubricate the moving parts either.
customer_reviews.author: Mendo View

customer_reviews.title: You HAVE to get some of these to believe how well they work!
customer_reviews.text: EVERY worker/handyman/DIYer needs some of these! They are sooooooo much better than traditional straps, yet they have the same capacity and flexibility...and they work soooo much faster too! Be careful with other designs/models as some of the strap-release features require two hands (but this type only needs one hand...which is Awesome!)
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Total Junk. Spring broke first time I used it. Their customer service is horrible! Buy any other company's products but this company's....
customer_reviews.author: Peanooty 1911

customer_reviews.title: These are the best! No more messy straps
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! No more messy straps! Cuts down on the time it takes to strap things! Strong and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: William Kinder

customer_reviews.title: Great invention.  Excellent ratchet ties.
customer_reviews.text: Great invention. The biggest hassle with ratchet ties is they get tangled. These are so convenient. I bought 8' models from a local auto parts store, but always seemed to need an extra foot. The 10' length is perfect. Just one word of advice... oil them every few months and they'll stay working like new.
customer_reviews.author: moocowman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Utilize these for securing my 850 lb motorcycle to my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Fire Chieftain

customer_reviews.title: Ratchets are garbage!
customer_reviews.text: 4 straps out of the 8 that I purchased failed during the first use. If you try to cinch your straps tightly, as you don't want your motorcycle's moving on a double trailer, the ratchet fails to grab and just slips. Would never purchase again. Knew that they were too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Francis L. Schlager

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: i like the function of the strap, im not sure about how strong it is
customer_reviews.author: Andre D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. Use them to secure bicycles in my truck bed. They do tend to slip a bit so you need to check them on longer trips, but they are so much better than traditional ratchet straps.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Reynolds

product_meta.title: Erickson 34415 Pro Series Black Retractable Ratcheting Tie-Down Strap (Pack of 2, 1" x 10')
product_meta.description: This is a 2-pack of Erickson's Professional Series retractable ratcheting tie-downs. Erickson's new patented design is the next step up in the tie-down industry. The retractables are simple to operate--simply pull the web out to the desired length and start ratcheting until tight. To release, simply push down on the red release button. The web not being used is stored in the center housing so you have no web blowing in the wind. This feature also keeps the straps clean and free from oil and dirt. This is Erickson's longest retractable strap at 1 inch wide by 10 feet long, with 1200 pounds load capacity and 400 pounds WLL (Working Load Limit). Erickson's Pro Series line-up of tie-downs was created for customers who are using tie-downs daily and want to upgrade from their last purchase. Erickson Manufacturing has been producing tie-down straps and related products for over 25 years. As a manufacturer of tie-down and towing products in North America, Erickson Manufacturing strives to provide the safest products with the consumer in mind.
feature_bullets: Simple and smart retractable ratcheting system
Unused web is stored in center so it does not flap in wind or get dirty
Contains two 1" x 10' long, black webbed, durable straps
1200 pounds load capacity and 400 pounds working load limit
